text: The "count" will work only in loop
Hubl doesn't support it to increase like other programming language.

Follow this code if you want:
`{% set count = [] %}`
`                  {% for content in contents %}`
`                       {% for topic in content.topic_list %}`

`                            {% if topic.slug == "organisatieontwikkeling" %}`
`                                {%  do count.append(1) %}`
`                           {% endif %}`
`                        `
`                       {% endfor %}`
`                  {% endfor %} `
 {% for item in count %}
    {{ loop.length }}
{% endfor %}
can you share full module code ?
thank you very much <@UMXHBH6TC>. I think next Hubl update has to consider this feature because *variable increment* in either loop or if statement is a standard operation in development/ web design.
<@UMXHBH6TC>, anyway, you saved me. is working nicely now
See <https://jinja.palletsprojects.com/en/2.10.x/templates/#assignments>. This is by language design
is there a reason why when swapping a template on a page. the modules wouldnâ€™t 100% update?.. its working on 1 page but not another. have a ticket open with support but they seems to be confused
